result.execSummary:
The defendant Tomba K Amara was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tomba K Amara is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Tomba K Amara was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Tomba K Amara was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Notice of Intent to Pursue Post Conviction Relief

Defendant Tomba K Amara in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Tomba K Amara in custody.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Probation having been revoked, sentencing proceeded.  Statements by each counsel and defendant. 

The court sentenced defendant to serve NINE MONTHS in the House of Correction with  NO Huber privileges. COURT OBJECTS TO electronic monitoring, credit for 150 days time served. 

Court ordered defendant to pay all MANDATORY  court costs, FEES  and surcharges by 8-29-16 and from 25% of prison wages or, if not paid,  civil judgment to be entered against the defendant. 

Information on Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Tomba K Amara not in court, in custody in Dane County.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant was not produced for today's hearing.  Branch 47 is in jury trial on another matter.   Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Sentencing after revocation hearing scheduled in Branch 47.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for June 30, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Motion for Grant of Bail.

Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and 
forwarded to Judge Siefert
for review. os

per order dated August 3, 2015, Appeal 2015AP1451CR, the appeal is voluntarily dismissed. We construe the Notice of Appeal filed in the Circuit Court as a timely filed Notice of Intent to Pursue Postconviction Relief. The Clerk of Circuit Court shall treat the Notice of Intent, as construed, as requesting that a State Public Defender be appointed to represent Amara. The Clerk of Circuit Court shall comply with the duties listed in Wis. Stat. Rule 809.30 (2)(b)1. no later than five days from the date of this order.

records.addlTxt: Copy of Notice of Appeal and a copy of the docket entries transmitted to the Court of Appeals.
filed.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by the State, Defense counsel and defendant.

As to Count 2:
Court sentenced defendant to serve 7 months in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence, straight time; credit for 1 (one) day served. Court objects to Electronic Monitoring.  Court objects to transfer to Dane County for confinement sentence.

As to Count 3:
Court WITHHELD sentence. 
Court placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 years (after the sentence as to Count 2 has been served) with the following conditions:
- Probation sentence may be served in Dane County.
- Attend/Participate in a Anger Management program
- AODA assessment and any treatment.
- Random urine screens.
- No fine
- No Contact Order with Alexis N.
- Pay Restitution in the amount of $990 to Alexis N. by 06-24-2018.

As to both counts:
- Court is silent as to the DV surcharge
Court ordered defendant to pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges by 06-24-2018.  Court orders penalty for Nonpayment of restitution, costs, fees, assessments and surcharges is conversion into a civil judgment.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Tomba K Amara in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Tomba K Amara in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Count 2 and Count 3:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

As to Count 1 and Count 4:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Count 1 and Count 4 DISMISSED.

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.
